#summary Setting up your GWT project to use gwt-earth-3
#labels Featured

=Getting Started=
  # Visit [http://code.google.com/apis/maps/signup.html http://code.google.com/apis/maps/signup.html] to sign up for an Earth Key for your domain. For development purposes you can enter a host name of 'localhost'. Make a note of the key that is generated as it will be needed in your code to load the Google Earth API. 

  # Add the following module import to your GWT module:  
{{{
      <inherits name='com.nitrous.gwt.earth.GwtEarthAPI'/>
}}}

  # Add the following to your project CSS file:
{{{
    .map3dcontainer {
	border: 1px solid silver;
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
    } 
    .map3d {
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
    }
}}}

  # Add [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-earth-3/downloads/list GwtEarth3-x.x.jar] to your project build path

  # See [https://code.google.com/p/gwt-earth-3/source/browse/trunk/src/com/nitrous/gwt/earth/client/demo/HelloWorldDemo.java HelloWorldDemo.java] for an example of how to get started with the code.

  # See Other demos and sample code [http://gwt-earth-demos.appspot.com/#HelloWorldDemo here].
